{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3574329,"name":null,"username":"Yuri","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/yuri/{size}/218839_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-30T23:33:01.246Z","cooked":"

my team want to start to use a limelight 3g to align with the reef when placing a coral, but we are not shure if we will need a second camera atached to the outtake for a human fine ajustment.

The limelight accuracy is just fine if you fuse it with your odometry. Tune it a charuco board. And set your standard deviations.

If you did the same steps and used PhotonVision I would think so. But I am not sure.

PhotonVision 2025 Releases PhotonVision
Hey all! PhotonVision v2025.1.1 is released. This is our first recommended version of the season. A full changelog is below. We appreciate the community’s patience in making sure multiple of these issues were resolved, as we believe it will lead to a much better user experience through the rest of the season. Aside from the developers below, we also wanted to give a sincere thanks to all the teams who helped test the release these past few days. These include members of 2471, 3256, 3546, 8429…
